page.title: 04LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Chipping Campden and the area about is a very peaceful place and its people are law-abiding. There is a Police Station in Campden in the High Street. It is manned by one sergeant and four constables but only up to midnight. After that time a cry for help would be passed to a larger station in the district. In an average week the police would be called out about twenty times for road accidents,petty crimes,traffic control and fires. They have to keep check on gun licences. On special occasions the police are helped by volunteers called Special Constables. These would keep order at election time or to control the crowds at Scuttlebrook Wake. The only weapons carried by the police are truncheons. In the courtroon attached to the station the Magistrates hear cases every second Wednesday.
